@rello fuck its refreshing to see someone who actually knows what netorare is and doesn't just think it literally means cheating. It's so fuckin exhausting to see all those comments saying "they weren't dating, so no ntr" displaying a clear lack of understanding of the concept.

@HentaiLover247 I never mentioned cheating, you illiterate piece of shit. Learn the difference between cheating and netorare before mouthing off about themes you know absolutely nothing about, and then take an acid bath. You can't even communicate in basic English without exposing yourself as a ten year-old with new-age spasticated slang like "incel" or "touch grass". As for soapALTER, you're a pathetic pussy who tries to push that narrative while simultaneously claiming clear instances of netorare aren't netorare because ???
The "insecurity" here is on you.
Great another one.

@HentaiLover247 just because two people aren’t in a relationship inside of a doujin doesn’t mean it’s not netorare. Netorare is used in a variety of ways but the three most common uses are 1. Cheating 2. Betrayal 3. Stealing. Or all three together. The first AND second ARE netorare because in the first their is the theme of stealing the older sister and the second is all three(I think they’re together in the second one but could be wrong). And stealing doesn’t always mean the girl is taken out of the relationship until the antagonist tells her to(if she falls to pleasure as provided in the second doujin)

@Rello Wrong again retard, it can't be cheating if they aren't in a relationship. You must be one pathetic mf to think just because you like a girl she's your gf and she's a cheater if she gets with someone else. Touch grass incel.

@HentaiLover24743 Take your own advice, retard. "Netorare" doesn't always mandate cheating on a romantic partner or spouse; if there's romantic interest and/or the theme of "stealing" or defilement is cemented in the face of another party, then it's netorare.
@Rello learn to read fuckface, that's her little brother watching, there is no cheating there. Kys

@soapALTER It is the dictionary definition of netorare. I don't mind if people like it or whatever, but don't try and save face and rationalise that it somehow isn't netorare so you can feel better about reading it.
